snippet: Tony Stewart, a three-time Nascar champion, ran over Kevin Ward Jr., 20, on Saturday while competing in a dirt-track sprint car event in upstate New York.
abstract: Three-time Nascar champion Tony Stewart fatally runs over driver Kevin Ward Jr while competing in a dirt-track sprint car event in upstate New York; Stewart is cooperating with police investigation; accident leaves racing community in mourning, Stewart's future in question and sport under microscope for its history of verbal and often violent confrontations between adrenaline-fueled drivers.

byline.contributor: Benjamin Mueller contributed reporting from Canandaigua, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: Tony Stewart, a three-time Nascar champion, ran over Kevin Ward Jr., 20, on Saturday while competing in a dirt-track sprint car event in upstate New York.

headline.main: A Nascar Star’s Deadly Run-In on a Dirt Track
headline.print_headline: A Nascar Star’s Deadly Run-In on a Dirt Track

keywords.value: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
